channel.title: Fixed thanks for the help!

item.title: Fixed thanks for the help!
item.dc:creator: @openice123 openice123
item.description:
@openice123 wrote:

im trying to get my red stone be loaded from Sprites.java but i need to know what the methods in background.java that are equvilent to the methods in sprites.java

i just need to know what method359 and method58 are

.\Java\client.java:7236: cannot find symbol symbol : method method358() location: class Sprite redStone1_2.method358(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7238: cannot find symbol symbol : method method358() location: class Sprite redStone2_2.method358(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7240: cannot find symbol symbol : method method359() location: class Sprite redStone1_3.method359(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7242: cannot find symbol symbol : method method359() location: class Sprite redStone2_3.method359(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7244: cannot find symbol symbol : method method359() location: class Sprite redStone3_2.method359(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7246: cannot find symbol symbol : method method358() location: class Sprite redStone1_4.method358(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7247: cannot find symbol symbol : method method359() location: class Sprite redStone1_4.method359(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7249: cannot find symbol symbol : method method358() location: class Sprite redStone2_4.method358(); ^ .\Java\client.java:7250: cannot find symbol symbol : method method359() location: class Sprite redStone2_4.method359(); ^ Note: .\Java\RSFrame.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 9 errors Press any key to continue . . .

or else just help me re name the 2 methods

[code] public void method358() {
byte abyte0[] = new byte[myWidth * myHeight];
int j = 0;

    for (int k = 0; k < myHeight; k++) {
        for (int l = myWidth - 1; l >= 0; l--) {
            abyte0[j++] = myPixels[l + k * myHeight];
        }

    }

    myPixels = abyte0;
    anInt1442 = anInt1444 - myWidth - myWidth;
}

public void method359() {
    byte abyte0[] = new byte[myWidth * myHeight];
    int i = 0;

    for (int j = myHeight - 1; j >= 0; j--) {
        for (int k = 0; k < myWidth; k++) {
            abyte0[i++] = myPixels[k + j * myWidth];
        }

    }

    myPixels = abyte0;
    anInt1443 = anInt1445 - myHeight - anInt1443;
}[/code]

errors

.\Java\Sprite.java:312: possible loss of precision found : int required: byte abyte0[j++] = myPixels[l + k * myHeight]; ^ .\Java\Sprite.java:317: incompatible types found : byte[] required: int[] myPixels = abyte0; ^ .\Java\Sprite.java:327: possible loss of precision found : int required: byte abyte0[i++] = myPixels[k + j * myWidth]; ^ .\Java\Sprite.java:332: incompatible types found : byte[] required: int[] myPixels = abyte0; ^ Note: .\Java\RSFrame.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 4 errors Press any key to continue . . .

fixed lol
just had to use method345()

Read full topic
